title: unable to import external Python module inside brownie script
body:
### Environment information

* `brownie: v1.14.6 - Python development framework for Ethereal
* `ganache-cli: Ganache CLI v6.12.2 (ganache-core: 2.13.2)
* Solc version: 0.8.4
* Python Version: 3.8.2
* OS: osx

### What was wrong?
I'm trying to use an external python module, PyGithub, in my python script in the scripts folder. Patrick Collins was able to reproduce the issue. See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/68947562/unable-to-use-python-module-inside-a-brownie-script-modulenotfounderror?noredirect=1#comment121872351_68947562

### Repro steps

I pip install it:

> pip install PyGithub

In scripts/mint.py, I import PyGithub:

from github import Github  <----- this line causes the error below
from brownie import accounts, convert

def main(): ...


When I try running it:

> brownie run mint.py

I get the error:

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'github'
The import statement works perfectly fine in python. Any suggestions on how to resolve this? thanks


### output

> brownie run mint.py
Brownie v1.14.6 - Python development framework for Ethereum

Compiling contracts...
  Solc version: 0.8.4
  Optimizer: Enabled  Runs: 200
  EVM Version: Istanbul
Generating build data...
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/IAccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/AccessControlUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/IAccessControlUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/OwnableUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/ERC1967UpgradeUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/IBeaconUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/Initializable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/UUPSUpgradeable
 - OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable@4.1.0/ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable

  File "brownie/_cli/run.py", line 49, in main
    return_value, frame = run(
  File "brownie/project/scripts.py", line 53, in run
    module = _import_from_path(script)
  File "brownie/project/scripts.py", line 149, in _import_from_path
    _import_cache[import_str] = importlib.import_module(import_str)
  File "/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/Library/Frameworks/Python3.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module
    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
  File "<frozen, line line, in in
  File "<frozen, line line, in in
  File "<frozen, line line, in in
  File "<frozen, line line, in in
  File "<frozen, line line, in in

    from github import Github
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'github'
Terminating local RPC client...
does someone know how to resolve this issue? thanks
Hi guys i fixed the error run project outside of my home directory. in my case PS C:\NFT\nft> brownie run scripts/simple_collectible/deploy_simple.py --network rinkeby
